alert.note: Alert for Chippewa; Douglas; Kandiyohi; Lac Qui Parle; Pope; Redwood; Renville; Stevens; Swift; Yellow Medicine (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 14 at 12:06PM CST until January 16 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...DANGEROUSLY COLD WIND CHILLS INTO NEXT WEEK... .Dangerous wind chills are expected to last through Tuesday morning, with widespread values of 25 to 40 degrees below zero. A Wind Chill Warning is in effect for western Minnesota tonight through Monday morning. A Wind Chill Advisory is in effect for eastern Minnesota and western Wisconsin tonight through Monday morning. After Monday morning, Wind Chill Advisories continue across Minnesota through Tuesday morning. ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CST TONIGHT... ...WIND CHILL WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO NOON CST MONDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM NOON MONDAY TO NOON CST TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 40 below zero. For the Wind Chill Advisories, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 35 below zero. * WHERE...Along and west of a line from Alexandria to Redwood Falls in western Minnesota. * WHEN...For the first Wind Chill Advisory, until midnight CST tonight. For the Wind Chill Warning, from midnight tonight to noon CST Monday. For the second Wind Chill Advisory, from noon Monday to noon CST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Don`t forget to limit the amount of time pets stay outdoors.
